STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 21, 2025
Victoria Schultz
Catholic Charities IEC Children's Home
2828 W. Willow St.,
LANSING, MI, 48917-1833
Re: License #: CI331000184
Dear Ms. Schultz:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 08/28/2025. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Tyler Armstrong, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 264-9217
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical assistance was provided in the area of features of secure programs as well
as the Plan Review process.

V. CONSULTATION
No consultation was provided during this inspection.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Financial Overview
This inspection period does not cover the first full year of operations of this
program, so a full financial audit has not yet been obtain.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator provided an assessment dated 10/03/2025. The facility
continues to work through a possible contract with MDHHS to provide services as
a psychiatric residential treatment facility.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed expressed positive sentiments about continuing to build the
program and take in youth in need of psychiatric treatment.
No youth have been placed at the facility during this reporting period.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility was toured and no concerns were noted. Several smaller upgrades
and safety features continue to be worked on in order to meet contractual
requirements.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
10/21/2025
_________________________________________________
Tyler Armstrong Date
